title: Add rate limiting to API
description: No protection against abuse. API is open to unlimited requests.
design: Add express-rate-limit middleware: 30 requests per minute per IP. Return 429 with Retry-After header.
close_reason: Implemented: Added express-rate-limit middleware. /api/fetch: 30 req/min, /api/batch-fetch: 5 req/min. Returns 429 with RateLimit headers.

title: Request concurrency limits
description: Limit concurrent fetchers (e.g., 4 at a time instead of all 8). Add sequential fallback mode for rate-limited scenarios. Priority queue: try fastest sources first.
close_reason: Added runWithConcurrencyLimit function to limit max concurrent fetchers to 4. Strategies are now sorted by priority before execution, so fastest/most reliable sources run first. CONCURRENCY_CONFIG allows easy tuning.

title: Adaptive backoff on HTTP 429
description: When receiving HTTP 429: parse Retry-After header, open circuit breaker for that source, log as RateLimitError. Update all fetchers.
close_reason: Already implemented in errors.mjs (RateLimitError class parses Retry-After header) and circuitBreaker.mjs (opens circuit on rate limit with appropriate timeout). throttleSource in rateLimiter.mjs handles explicit throttling.

title: Update package.json with ICanHazPDF metadata
description: Update name to icanhazpdf, add author, repository URL, bugs URL, homepage, engines field, and keywords.
close_reason: Updated package.json with name, author, repository, bugs, homepage, engines fields

title: Show live source progress in UI
description: UI shows generic "Searching..." loading state. Could show which sources are being tried.
design: Update UI to consume SSE stream (depends on paper-fetcher-m4b) or poll status endpoint. Show checkmarks/X for each source tried.
close_reason: Added SSE-powered live progress showing each source being tried with status icons

title: Add PDF content-type validation
description: HEAD request only checks URL exists, not that it's actually a PDF. Can return HTML error pages as "successful" PDFs.
design: Verify Content-Type header includes 'application/pdf'. Optionally check first bytes for PDF magic number (%PDF-).
close_reason: Implemented: Created pdfValidator.mjs utility that checks Content-Type header. Applied to arXiv fetcher. Validates PDF vs HTML error pages.

title: Add structured logging with pino
description: Currently uses console.log throughout. Hard to parse in production, no log levels.
design: Replace console.log with pino logger. JSON output for production, pretty print for dev. Add request IDs for tracing.
close_reason: Added pino structured logging with pretty output in dev, JSON in prod, and request context

title: Create GitHub issue and PR templates
description: Add .github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md, feature_request.md, and PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md for better contributor experience.
close_reason: Created bug_report.md, feature_request.md, and PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md

title: Replace JSON file cache with Vercel KV
description: cache.json is ephemeral in serverless - each invocation gets fresh state. Cache is useless on Vercel.
design: Use Vercel KV (Redis) or Upstash Redis. Keep JSON file as fallback for local dev. Abstract cache interface for swappable backends.
close_reason: Implemented: Created cache.mjs abstraction layer. Uses Vercel KV when KV_REST_API_URL set, falls back to JSON file locally. 30-day TTL.

title: Request correlation IDs in logging
description: Add request correlation IDs across all logs. Log per-fetcher timing: { source: 'arXiv', durationMs: 234, status: 'found' }. Add traceId to SSE events for debugging.
close_reason: Added generateCorrelationId, updated createFetchLogger to accept correlationId, added logSourceTiming for per-source timing. Correlation IDs now appear in all logs.

title: Implement parallel fetching with early termination
description: Sequential fallback is slow: 8 sources × 10s timeout = up to 80s for failed lookup. Should fetch in parallel and return first success.
design: Use Promise.any() or custom race with early termination. Group sources by reliability tier. Cancel pending requests once PDF found. Trade-off: more API calls but 5-10x faster.
close_reason: Implemented: All 7 sources run in parallel, best result selected by priority. Tests show 3-5 sources finding PDFs simultaneously.

title: Circuit breaker pattern
description: Create src/circuitBreaker.mjs to track failure rates per source. States: Closed (normal), Open (skip after 5 consecutive failures), Half-Open (try one request after 60s cooldown). Integrate with paperFetcher.mjs.
close_reason: Implemented src/circuitBreaker.mjs with Closed/Open/Half-Open states, failure tracking, and rate limit handling. Integrated with paperFetcher.mjs to skip unhealthy sources and protect fetch calls.

title: Add copy BibTeX button when DOI found
description: If DOI is found, could fetch and display citation for easy copy.
design: Use doi.org content negotiation to get BibTeX: Accept: application/x-bibtex. Add copy button to result card.
close_reason: Added GET /api/bibtex endpoint and UI Copy BibTeX button with doi.org content negotiation

title: Delete /codex folder (deprecated Python implementation)
description: Remove the deprecated Python/FastAPI implementation to clean up the repo for open source release.
close_reason: Codex folder deleted

title: Add request deduplication for concurrent lookups
description: Two simultaneous requests for same paper = 2x API calls. Should deduplicate in-flight requests.
design: Use Map to track in-flight requests by normalized title. Return existing promise if request already pending.
close_reason: Implemented in-flight request deduplication using Map to track pending requests

title: Create SECURITY.md
description: Add security policy with vulnerability reporting process.
close_reason: Created SECURITY.md with vulnerability reporting process

title: Return partial results when PDF not found
description: When PDF not found but metadata/DOI exists, return it so user can try other methods (library request, Sci-Hub).
design: Add partial: true flag to response. Include doi, metadata even on failure. UI can show "No open PDF, but found DOI: ..." with copy button.
close_reason: Implemented: Returns partial:true with doi and metadata when PDF not found. Collects metadata from all sources, not just successful ones.

title: PDF URL validation
description: Before returning PDF URL: validate URL format, check Content-Type header is application/pdf, optionally verify PDF magic bytes (%PDF-). Apply to all fetchers (currently only arXiv does this).
close_reason: Added validatePdfUrl function with URL format validation, Content-Type header check, and optional PDF magic bytes verification. Added validatedSuccessResult helper for use by fetchers.

title: Add DOI-based lookup endpoint
description: Many users have DOIs, not titles. Direct path to Unpaywall would be faster and more reliable.
design: POST /api/fetch-by-doi { "doi": "10.1234/..." }. Direct call to Unpaywall, skip title search entirely.
close_reason: Implemented: POST /api/fetch-by-doi endpoint. Validates DOI format, calls Unpaywall directly. Rate limited.

title: Move /claude contents to repository root
description: Move all code from /claude/ to root for cleaner repo structure. Update all paths and imports accordingly.
close_reason: Contents already moved to root

title: Create CONTRIBUTING.md
description: Add contribution guidelines: how to report bugs, suggest features, development setup, testing, PR process.
close_reason: Created CONTRIBUTING.md with guidelines for adding new fetchers

title: Metrics collection endpoint
description: Create src/metrics.mjs to track per-source: request count, success rate, avg latency, cache hit/miss ratio, rate limit hits. Add /api/metrics endpoint (JSON or Prometheus format).
close_reason: Created src/metrics.mjs with per-source tracking (request counts, success rates, latencies, rate limits). Added /api/metrics (JSON) and /api/metrics?format=prometheus endpoints, plus /api/sources/health for circuit breaker status.

title: Cache size limits (LRU eviction)
description: For JSON file cache: implement LRU eviction when exceeding max entries (10,000) or max file size (50MB).
close_reason: Implemented LRU eviction with evictLRU function that removes oldest 10% of entries when cache exceeds maxEntries (10,000).

title: Add search history with localStorage
description: UI doesn't remember previous searches. Users often retry similar queries.
design: Store last 10 searches in localStorage. Show as clickable chips below search box. Clear button to reset.
close_reason: Added localStorage-based search history with clickable chips and clear button

title: Add deep health check endpoint
description: /api/health only returns { status: 'ok' }. Doesn't verify sources are reachable.
design: Add /api/health/deep that pings each source API (with caching). Return status per source. Main /api/health stays fast for load balancer checks.
close_reason: Added GET /api/health/deep with per-source status, latency, and overall health summary

title: Add SSE progress streaming for source attempts
description: UI shows generic "Searching..." but could show which sources are being tried in real-time.
design: New endpoint GET /api/fetch-stream?title=... returning SSE events: trying, skipped, found, failed. UI updates live.
close_reason: SSE streaming endpoint implemented at GET /api/fetch-stream with real-time progress events

title: Fix arXiv title matching - validate results before returning
description: arXiv fetcher takes first result without validating title match, causing false positives. Other fetchers (Semantic Scholar, Crossref) use isTitleMatch but arXiv doesn't.
design: Import isTitleMatch in arxiv.mjs and validate entry.title[0] against search title before returning. Loop through results like other fetchers do.
close_reason: Fixed: Added isTitleMatch validation, loops through results, also fixed http→https for PDF URLs

title: Rebrand to ICanHazPDF - update all documentation
description: Rewrite README.md with ICanHazPDF branding. Tagline: 'The legal way to get that PDF'. Update all references from paper-fetcher to ICanHazPDF.
close_reason: Updated README.md with ICanHazPDF branding, tagline, and concise documentation

title: Update UI branding to ICanHazPDF
description: Change UI title from 'PAPER FETCHER' to 'ICANHAZPDF'. Update footer text. Change localStorage key from paper_fetcher_history to icanhazpdf_history.
close_reason: Updated index.html with ICANHAZPDF title, tagline, and localStorage key

title: Enhanced health check with per-source status
description: Enhance /api/health/deep to test each source with a known paper (cached OK). Report per-source status: { arxiv: 'healthy', core: 'degraded' }. Include circuit breaker states.
close_reason: Enhanced /api/health/deep to include circuit breaker states for each source. Added enriched source statuses with CB state, failures, and success rate. Summary now includes circuitBreakersOpen count.

title: Extract shared fetcher logic into baseFetcher
description: Every fetcher repeats: axios call with timeout, error wrapping, result normalization. Lots of duplicate code.
design: Create src/fetchers/baseFetcher.mjs with fetchWithRetry(url, options, parser) handling shared timeout, retry logic, and error formatting.
close_reason: Created baseFetcher.mjs with fetchWithRetry, successResult, failureResult. Refactored OpenAlex as example.

title: Negative caching for failed lookups
description: Cache failures (paper not found) with shorter TTL (1 day) to prevent repeated expensive searches for paywalled papers. Key: negative:${normalizedTitle}
close_reason: Implemented cacheSetNegative and cacheGetNegative functions with 1-day TTL. Failed lookups are now cached to avoid repeated expensive searches.

title: Error classification system
description: Create error taxonomy in src/errors.mjs: TransientError (retry: timeout, 5xx, rate limit), PermanentError (don't retry: 404, 403, invalid format), RateLimitError (backoff longer, respect Retry-After header). Update fetchers to use these error types.
close_reason: Implemented src/errors.mjs with TransientError, PermanentError, RateLimitError classes and classifyError, isRetryable, getRetryDelay helpers. Updated baseFetcher.mjs withRetry to use error classification.

title: Cache invalidation & staleness
description: Implement maxAge config (7 days for success, 1 day for not found). Add stale-while-revalidate: serve stale cache, refresh in background. cachedAt timestamps already added.
close_reason: Implemented cache invalidation with maxAge config, stale-while-revalidate pattern with background refresh, and checkStaleness function.

title: Create CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
description: Add Contributor Covenant code of conduct for community standards.
close_reason: Created CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md with Contributor Covenant v2.0

title: Create LICENSE file (MIT)
description: Add full MIT license text to LICENSE file in repository root. Required for legal clarity.
close_reason: Created MIT LICENSE file

title: Source-aware rate limiting
description: Create src/rateLimiter.mjs to respect external API limits: PubMed (3 req/sec), Crossref (50 req/sec). Add per-source request queues with rate limiting.
close_reason: Created src/rateLimiter.mjs with token bucket algorithm, per-source rate limits (arXiv 1rps, Semantic Scholar 0.33rps, PubMed 3rps, Crossref 10rps, etc.), withRateLimit wrapper, and throttleSource for Retry-After handling.

title: Add TypeScript for type safety
description: No type safety currently. Would benefit from interfaces for FetchResult, PaperMetadata, FetcherOptions.
design: Add tsconfig.json, rename .mjs to .ts, define interfaces. Could use JSDoc types as lighter alternative.
close_reason: Added JSDoc types in types.mjs and jsconfig.json for editor intellisense. Full TS migration can be done incrementally.
